00022 /*
00023         This file is just for debugging the B+ tree... thus why it is in its
00024         own file. You only need it if you call the print function. 
00025         
00026         You need to include this directly. Sorry.
00027 */
00028  
00029 
00030 #ifdef SDBX_BTREE_H 
00031  
00032 
00033 #ifndef SDBX_BTREE_PRINT_H
00034 #define SDBX_BTREE_PRINT_H
00035 
00036 #include <vector>
00037 #include <iostream>
00038 #include <sstream>
00039 #include <fstream>
00040 #include <string>
00041 
00042 // testing only: traverse the tree and print it out in a graphviz format
00043 // returns the number of leaves it printed out
00044 __BTREE_TEMPLATE_DEFN
00045 uint64_t BTree<__BTREE_TEMPLATE_FN>::Print(const char * filename = "tree")
00046 {
00047         uint64_t leaf_count = 0;
00048         std::ofstream output;
00049         std::string digraph(filename);
00050         output.open((digraph + ".dot").c_str(), std::ifstream::trunc);
00051         
00052         output << "digraph " << filename << " {\nnode [shape = record];\n";
00053         
00054         if (backend.m_treeHeight)
00055         {
00056                 std::vector<IdType>                     id;
00057                 std::vector<std::size_t>        idx;
00058 
00059                 // reduce allocations
00060                 id.reserve(backend.m_treeHeight);
00061                 idx.reserve(backend.m_treeHeight);
00062                 
00063                 id.push_back(backend.m_rootId);
00064                 idx.push_back(0);
00065         
00066                 // this could be recursive, but that would be so much easier! :)
00067                 while (!id.empty())
00068                 {
00069                         if (id.size() < backend.m_treeHeight)
00070                         {
00071                                 Node * node = backend.get_node(id.back());
00072                                 std::size_t cur_idx = idx.back();
00073                                 
00074                                 if (cur_idx <= node->items.size())
00075                                 {
00076                                         // define the node label and its parent
00077                                         if (cur_idx == 0)
00078                                         {
00079                                                 // linkage
00080                                                 if (id.size() == 1)
00081                                                         output << "\"root\" -> \"";
00082                                                 else
00083                                                         output << "\"node" << *(id.end()-2) << "\" -> \"";
00084 
00085                                                 output << "node" << id.back() << "\"\nnode" << id.back() << " [ label =\"";
00086 
00087                                                 // label
00088                                                 int i = 1;
00089                                                 for (NodeItemIterator it = node->items.begin(); it != node->items.end(); ++it, ++i)
00090                                                         output << "<f" << i << "> " <<  it->key << " | ";
00091 
00092                                                 while (i <= max_child_items)
00093                                                         output << "<f" << (i++) << "> x | ";
00094 
00095                                                 output << "<f" << i << ">\"];\n";
00096                                         }
00097                                 
00098 
00099                                         if (idx.back()++ == node->items.size())
00100                                                 // then traverse down the last id in our set
00101                                                 id.push_back(node->end_id);
00102                                         else
00103                                                 // otherwise iterate over all nodes
00104                                                 id.push_back(node->items[idx.back()-1].id);
00105                                         
00106                                         idx.push_back(0);
00107                                         continue;
00108                                 }
00109                         }
00110                         else
00111                         {
00112                                 // at a leaf: print it out
00113                                 LeafNode * leaf = backend.get_leaf_node(id.back());
00114                                 
00115                                 if (id.size() == 1)
00116                                         output << "\"root\" -> \"";
00117                                 else
00118                                         output << "\"node" << *(id.end()-2) << "\":f" << *(idx.end()-2) << " -> \"";
00119 
00120                                 // print out all of the nodes
00121                                 int i = 1;
00122                                 for (LeafItemIterator it = leaf->items.begin(); it != leaf->items.end(); ++it, ++i)
00123                                         output << it->key << " | ";
00124 
00125                                 while (i++ <= max_child_items)
00126                                         output << "x | ";
00127 
00128                                 leaf_count += leaf->items.size();
00129 
00130                                 output << "\"\n";
00131                         }
00132                         
00133                         // go up a level
00134                         id.pop_back();
00135                         idx.pop_back();         
00136                 }
00137         }
00138 
00139         output << "}\n";
00140         output << "# " << leaf_count << " leaves visited\n"; 
00141         output.close();
00142 
00143         return leaf_count;
00144 }
00145 
00146 
00147 #endif
00148 #endif
